tool_description: An API for returning global statistics for multiple diseases.
name: COVID19 Statistics
title: COVID19 Statistics

api_list.name: AllGHICSSE
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://covid19-statistics.p.rapidapi.com/v2/jhucsse"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "covid19-statistics.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())
api_list.convert_code:
import requests

url = "https://covid19-statistics.p.rapidapi.com/v2/jhucsse"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "covid19-statistics.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

api_list.name: AllContinents
api_list.description: Returns a JSON array with an element for each continent that has stats available.

required_parameters.name: yesterday
required_parameters.description:
For this parameter you can show yesterday data

Available values : true, false, 1, 0.

required_parameters.name: sort
required_parameters.description:
For this parameter you can provide a key from the country model (e.g. cases, todayCases, deaths, recovered, active, etc) to sort the countries from greatest to least, depending on the key

Available values : cases, todayCases, deaths, todayDeaths, recovered, active, critical, casesPerOneMillion, deathsPerOneMillion.

api_list.name: HistoricalData
api_list.description: Get time series info from the JHU CSSE Data Repository. Every date since 1/22/20 has an entry tracking deaths, cases, and recoveries for each country. Updated each day at 23:59 UTC. Data is updated every 10 minutes.

required_parameters.name: lastdays
required_parameters.description: number of days you want the data to go back to. Default is 30. Use all for full data set. Ex: 15, all, 24

api_list.name: StateData
api_list.description: Return all NYT state data or individual state data if specified. Each entry returned represents data for a given day.

required_parameters.name: state
required_parameters.description: The state that you'd like to search for, separated by comma if you want to search for multiple (i.e. 'California, Washington'. Default is full data set.

api_list.name: SpecificContry
api_list.description: Get the same data from the /countries endpoint, but filter down to a specific country.

required_parameters.name: query
required_parameters.description: For this parameter you can use Country Name && Country Id && ISOs (ISO 2 | ISO 3) 3166 Country Standards

required_parameters.name: query
required_parameters.description: The continent name.

required_parameters.name: yesterday
required_parameters.description:
For this parameter you can show yesterday data

Available values : true, false, 1, 0.

required_parameters.name: strict
required_parameters.description: Defaults to true. Setting to false gives you the ability to fuzzy search countries. Example Oman vs. rOMANia

api_list.name: CountyData
api_list.description: Return all NYT county data or individual county data if specified. Each entry returned represents data for a given day.

required_parameters.name: county
required_parameters.description: The county that you'd like to search for, separated by comma if you want to search for multiple (i.e. 'Alameda, Humboldt'). Default is full data set.

api_list.name: State

required_parameters.name: states
required_parameters.description: state name or comma separated names spelled correctly.

required_parameters.name: yesterday
required_parameters.description:
For this parameter you can show yesterday data
Available values : true, false, 1, 0.

api_list.name: States
api_list.description: Get stats on United States of America States with COVID-19, including cases, new cases, deaths, new deaths, and active cases. Data is updated every 10 minutes.

required_parameters.name: sort
required_parameters.description:
For this parameter you can provide a key from the country model (e.g. cases, todayCases, deaths, active, etc) to sort the states from greatest to least, depending on the key.

Available values : cases, todayCases, deaths, todayDeaths, active.

required_parameters.name: yesterday
required_parameters.description:
For this parameter you can show yesterday data

Available values : true, false, 1, 0.

api_list.name: HistoricalDatabyCountryName
api_list.description: Get a country's time series using a country iso code, country ID, or of course, country name. Data is updated every 10 minutes.

required_parameters.name: lastdays
required_parameters.description: Number of days you want the data to go back to. Default is 30. Use all for full data set. Ex: 15, all, 24

required_parameters.name: query
required_parameters.description: Required. For this parameter you can use Country Name && Country Id && ISOs (ISO 2 | ISO 3) 3166 Country Standards

api_list.name: AllCountries
api_list.description: Returns a JSON array with an element for each country that has stats available. This includes iso codes, lat/long, a link to the country flag, cases, new cases, deaths, new deaths, recovered, active cases, critical cases, and cases/deaths per one million people. Data is updated every 10 minutes.

required_parameters.name: sort
required_parameters.description:
For this parameter you can provide a key from the country model (e.g. cases, todayCases, deaths, recovered, active, etc) to sort the countries from greatest to least, depending on the key

Available values : cases, todayCases, deaths, todayDeaths, recovered, active, critical, casesPerOneMillion, deathsPerOneMillion.

required_parameters.name: yesterday
required_parameters.description:
For this parameter you can show yesterday data

Available values : true, false, 1, 0.

api_list.name: USNationwideData
api_list.description: Return all NYT US nationwide data. Each entry returned represents data for a given day.
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://covid19-statistics.p.rapidapi.com/v2/nyt/usa"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "covid19-statistics.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

url = "https://covid19-statistics.p.rapidapi.com/v2/nyt/usa"

headers = {

            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "covid19-statistics.p.rapidapi.com"

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

api_list.name: USAstatestoquery/historical/usacounties/{state}endpoint
api_list.description: Returns a list of states that are available for querying the /historical/usacounties/{state} endpoint with.
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://covid19-statistics.p.rapidapi.com/v2/historical/usacounties"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "covid19-statistics.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

api_list.name: SpecificContinent
api_list.description: Get the same data from the /v2/continents endpoint, but filter down to a specific continent.

required_parameters.name: query
required_parameters.description: The continent name.

required_parameters.name: strict
required_parameters.description:
Defaults to true. Setting to false gives you the ability to fuzzy search countries. Example Oman vs. rOMANia

Available values : true, false.

required_parameters.name: yesterday
required_parameters.description:
For this parameter you can show yesterdays data

Available values : true, false, 1, 0.

api_list.name: HistoricalTimeSeriesData
api_list.description: Return time series data globally. Data is updated every 10 minutes.
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://covid19-statistics.p.rapidapi.com/v2/historical/all"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "covid19-statistics.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

api_list.name: All
api_list.description: Get global stats: cases, deaths, recovered, time last updated, and active cases. Data is updated every 10 minutes.

required_parameters.name: yesterday
required_parameters.description: For this parameter you can show yesterday data. Available values : true, false, 1, 0.

api_list.name: HistoricalDataforallCountiesinaSpecifiedState
api_list.description: Get time series info from the JHU CSSE Data Repository. Every date since 1/22/20 has an entry tracking deaths and cases. Updated each day at 23:59 UTC. Data is updated every 10 minutes.

required_parameters.name: state
required_parameters.description: Required. A valid US state name, validated in the array returned from /v2/historical/usacounties.

required_parameters.name: lastdays
required_parameters.description:
number of days you want the data to go back to. Default is 30. Use all for full data set. Ex: 15, all, 24. 
Default value: 30

api_list.name: SingleCountyData
api_list.description: Get JHU CSSE county specific data. This includes confirmed cases, deaths, recovered, and coordinates. Returns array because there are duplicate names. Data is updated every 10 minutes.
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://covid19-statistics.p.rapidapi.com/v2/jhucsse/counties/Abbeville"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "covid19-statistics.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())
api_list.convert_code:
import requests

url = "https://covid19-statistics.p.rapidapi.com/v2/jhucsse/counties/{countyname}"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "covid19-statistics.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

api_list.name: AllUSCountyData
api_list.description: Get JHU CSSE county specific data. This includes confirmed cases, deaths, recovered, and coordinates. Data is updated every 10 minutes

api_list.name: HistoricalDatabyProvinceName
api_list.description: Get a province within a country's time series. Example is /v2/historical/chn/tibet. CHN is China's iso3 code. Data is updated every 10 minutes.

required_parameters.name: query
required_parameters.description: Required. For this parameter you can use Country Name && Country Id && ISOs (ISO 2 | ISO 3) 3166 Country Standards.

required_parameters.name: province
required_parameters.description: Required. Province name.

required_parameters.name: lastdays
required_parameters.description: Number of days you want the data to go back to. Default is 30. Use all for full data set. Ex: 15, all, 24.

api_list.name: HistoricalDatabymultipleProvinceNames
api_list.description: Get multiple provinces' time series using multiple Country Names && Country Ids && ISOs (ISO 2 | ISO 3) 3166 Country Standards. Data is updated every 10 minutes.

required_parameters.name: provinces
required_parameters.description: Required. Provinces spelled correctly separated by ',' or '|' delimiters, never both in the same query.

required_parameters.name: query
required_parameters.description: Required. For this parameter you can use multiple Country Names && Country Ids && ISOs (ISO 2 | ISO 3) 3166 Country Standards separated by commas.

required_parameters.name: lastdays
required_parameters.description: Number of days you want the data to go back to. Default is 30. Use all for full data set. Ex: 15, all, 24
